page.title: 08AINSDALE NATURE RESERVE
page.content: THE NATURE RESERVE WAS PURCHASED IN 1965 TO SAFEGUARD PART OF THE FINEST EXAMPLE OF A SAND_DUNE SYSTEM IN NORTH_WESTERN ENGLAND. THE ANIMALS WHICH ARE FOUND INCLUDE THE NATTERJACK TOAD AND SAND LIZARD. THE RESERVE CONSISTS OF SAND_DUNES, MARSHY SLACKS AND PINEWOODS. THE NATIONAL TRUST AND NATURE CONSERVANCY COUNCIL BOTH OWN LAND ON THE COAST, AND SINCE 1980 SEFTON COUNCIL HAS DECLARED 2 LOCAL NATURE RESERVES, ONE IN AINSDALE AND BIRKDALE HILLS AND THE OTHER AT RAVENMEOLS. THERE ARE 6 MILES OF MARKED PATHS WHERE YOU CAN SEE MANY DIFFERENT PLANTS SUCH AS THE MEADOW ORCHID,MARSH HELLEBORINE,THE LARGER WINTERGREEN AND THE RESTHARROW.
